page.title: 03SOUTHLEIGH
page.content: The village of Southleigh is the only settlement in the survey block. The village is sited on a small stream that flows into the Coly. Southleigh has a population 203 in 1981. The population has remained around 150 from about 1901,and the small increase in recent years represents an influx of retired people rather than an internal growth. The village has few services,apart from the parish church and village hall the only other service is the post office and general store. There was a primary school but this is now closed.Buses are few in thw area resulting in it's isolation.
